disturb.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing
disturb.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Sorry to disturb you, but I have an urgent message.
The thieves fled when they were disturbed by a neighbour.
Do not disturb  (=a sign you put on a door so that people will not interrupt you).
disturb.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make someone feel worried or upset
disturb.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: What disturbs you most about this latest development?
disturb.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to move something or change its position
disturb.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: If you find a birdâ€™s nest, never disturb the eggs.
I promise not to disturb anything.
disturb.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to change a normal situation in a way that causes problems
disturb.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: My hormone balance is disturbed by my pregnancy.
New procedures often disturb the comfortable habits of the workforce.
disturb.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Local people said their sleep was being disturbed by the noise from the aircraft.
I couldn't work with the kids around disturbing my concentration.
A gentle knock on the door disturbed his thoughts.
Sorry to disturb you, but could you sign this letter, please?
